definitions.text: an acrobatic feat of rolling or turning end over end
a sudden drop from an upright position
examples: he had a nasty spill on the ice
The tower of the World Trade Center tumbled after the plane hit it

definitions.text: cause to topple or tumble by pushing
roll over and over, back and forth

examples: The clothes tumbled in the dryer
rising smoke whirled in the air
the building crumbled after the explosion

definitions.text: throw together in a confused mass
examples: They tumbled the teams with no apparent pattern

definitions.text: understand, usually after some initial difficulty
examples: She didn't know what her classmates were plotting but finally caught on
Prices tumbled after the devaluation of the currency

definitions.text: put clothes in a tumbling barrel, where they are whirled about in hot air, usually with the purpose of drying
examples: Wash in warm water and tumble dry

definitions.text: suffer a sudden downfall, overthrow, or defeat
do gymnastics, roll and turn skillfully
